p: Phenolic lignan, nordihydroguaiaretic acid (NDGA), has been isolated from leaves of Larrea tridentate (DC.) Coville found in Mexico and USA deserts. NGDA is approximately 5 to 10% of the leaf dry weight (80% of all phenolic compounds in the resin). The catechol rings present in their structure confer antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties to this hypolipidemic agent [ 115]. NDGA is also known for its cytoprotective effects in nontumor cells and its proapoptotic activity in malignant cells. These facts make NDGA a promising antitumor compound that regulates several signaling pathways and controls cellular damage by reactive oxygen species (ROS) [ 116, 117].
